page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: From our sample of six farms in our km square 70% of land use is pasture and 30% arable. The three cereal crops of wheat, barley and oats being the chief crops grown with a small amount of oil seed rape. Grass, swede and turnips are grown for animal feed. There are 3 dairy herds of 380 cows in all and two large flocks of sheep - 2586 altogether,plus a herd of 400 beef cattle. So it seems to be a mixed farming area. One farmer breeds horses and on his land an annual national level horse show is held. This is the Kilsby Gymkhana. This is a qualifying round for important national show jumping events and well-known show jumpers come to Kilsby to take part.
